string.name: name
string.value: You Can't Teach an Old Dog New Tricks
#b#@1020000:##k in #bPerion#k says he may be able to uncover the red portion of the #rDirty Treasure Map#k. Let's talk to him.

He suggests you do not waste your time and energy chasing after some nonexistent treasure, but instead hunt #rDark Stumps#k to clear your head. They can be easily found in #b#m101030000##k.\n\nReport back to #b#@1020000:##k in #bPerion#k upon completion.
#b#@1020000:##k in #bPerion#k says he may be able to uncover the red portion of the #rDirty Treasure Map#k. Let's talk to him.

string.name: rewardSummary
string.value: Exp 1,800 Able to proceed to 'The Mystery of the Red Portion' as next quest.

A Treasure Map? I don't know where you found such a thing, but don't waste your time with that.
There are no treasures in the world. How do I know that? Well, when I was young, I spent a good portion of my youth searching for treasure, thinking that it was really a Treasure Map. 

Look, I'm telling you again, there are no treasures in this world! Why don't you just get some fresh air?

You'll find a lot of #rDark Stumps#k in #b#m101030000##k. Why don't you just defeat 30 of them? Hopefully, you'll come to your senses while hunting and realize that there is no such thing as a Treasure Map.
Don't decline. You should take my advice!
You're stronger than I thought.\n\nHow was it? Have you not come to your senses yet about the Treasure Map?

Don't even think about treasures from this point forward. It is only a waste of valuable time and energy.

....

But where did you find that map anyway?
I'm asking only out of curiosity, of courseâ€¦

What? You got it from #b#p1072008##k in #bNautilus#k?
Oh! Then it can't be fake.

Could I take a look at it? I just want to see something. Don't give me that look!
I thought I told you to defeat 30 #rDark Stumps#k!
